column4: sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg will give you a new xorg.conf file
That's what generated the one I posted which is apparently a mess
are you trying to install the new ati driver that supports desktop effects?
ok this is how I got mine working on my x300, scroll down to "Install from ati.com (latest version of drivers)" at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI
Its how I got mine to work
replace feisty with gutsy in the first step though
Just dont forget to follow steps 14 15 16 on http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=591066 also
Nope, I rebooted after doing that, logged in, and just got a while screen, had to select Failsafe GNOME to get back in.
, theres a few over at #ati right now
you did follow steps 14 15 16 at the link I gave you right?
